verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O the times are hard and the wages low, Leave her, Johnny, leave her! I think it's time for us to go! An' it's time for us to leave her!

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Leave her, Johnny, leave her! Oh, leave her, Johnny, leave her! For the voyage is done an' the winds don't blow, An' it's time for us to leave her!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: O I thought I heard the old man say, Tomorrow ye will get your pay!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: It's Liverpool Pat with his tarpaulin hat, It's Yankee John the packet rat.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: It's rotten beef an' weev'ly bread, It's pump or drown the old man said.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: The wind was foul an' the sea ran high, She shipped it green an' none went by.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: We'd be better off in a nice clean gaol, With all night in an' plenty o' ale!

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: The mate was a bucko an' the old man a Turk, The bosun was a beggar with the middle name o' work!

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: It's growl yer may an' go yer must, It matters not whether yer last or first!

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: The cook's a drunk, he likes to booze, 'tween him an' the mate there's little to choose!

verse.name: v10
verse.lines: I hate to sail on this rotten tub, No grog allowed and rotten grub!

verse.name: v11
verse.lines: The ship won't steer, or stay, or wear, An' so us shellbacks learnt to swear.

verse.name: v12
verse.lines: No Liverpool bread, nor rotten crackerhash, No dandyfunk, nor cold an' sloppy hash.

verse.name: v13
verse.lines: The old man shouts, the pumps stand by, Oh, we can never suck her dry.

verse.name: v14
verse.lines: Now I thought I hear the old man say, Just one more pull an' then belay.

verse.name: v15
verse.lines: We swear by rote for want o' more, But now we're through so we'll go on shore.
